audios.au: The memory levels 1 and 2 are reference levels for loading and unloading, for instance adjusted to the heights of the loading ramps of frequently supplied customers.
In difference to the unloading level the memory levels are not defined via parameterizing. They are specified by the driver using the remote-control unit, to be able to address them any time again.
They are stored in the ECU until redefined by the driver using the remote-control unit.
